response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [CHUNK_1] It appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. [CHUNK_36] The following sums, or so much thereof as may be sufficient to accomplish the purposes and programs designated herein, are appropriated or authorized from the sources of funding specified to the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_5]",
  "appropriations": "This Act appropriates sums to accomplish the purposes and programs designated to the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_5] The bill appropriates $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in general obligation bond funds for investment capital under JUD601 - Administration for fiscal year 2025-2026. [CHUNK_11] The sum of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) appropriated or authorized in part II of this Act for capital improvement projects shall be expended by the judiciary for the projects listed in the Act. [CHUNK_15]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The sums appropriated are designated for the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_5] The total expenditures and the number of permanent and temporary positions established in each fiscal year of the fiscal biennium shall not exceed the sums and the position ceilings indicated for each year, except as provided in this Act. [CHUNK_6] The appropriations made for capital improvement projects authorized in part II and listed in part IV of this Act shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [CHUNK_22]",
  "agency_impact": "Whenever the need arises, the chief justice, in administering an equitable and expeditious judicial process, may transfer sufficient funds and positions between programs for operating purposes. [CHUNK_11] The judiciary may delegate to other state or county agencies the planning, acquisition of land, design, construction, and equipment of any capital improvement project when it is determined by the judiciary to be advantageous to do so. [CHUNK_24] The chief justice shall determine when and the manner in which the authorized capital improvement projects shall be initiated. [CHUNK_28]",
  "economic_impact": "This Act appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. [CHUNK_36] If the chief justice, or any agency or government unit, secures federal funds or other property under any act of Congress, or any funds or other property from private organizations or individuals, to be expended in connection with any program or works authorized by this Act, they may enter into the undertaking. [CHUNK_13] The chief justice, or the agency or government unit with the chief justice's approval, may enter into the undertaking with the federal government, private organization, or individual. [CHUNK_14]",
  "policy_impact": "This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [CHUNK_1] The chief justice may transfer sufficient funds and positions between programs for operating purposes, provided no transfer shall be made to implement any collective bargaining contract signed after this legislature adjourns sine die. [CHUNK_11] If the amount allocated from the general obligation bond fund for a capital improvement project is insufficient, the chief justice may make supplemental allotments from the judiciary project adjustment fund. [CHUNK_26]",
  "revenue_sources": "The sources from which funds are appropriated are referred to as \"Means of Financing,\" or \"MOF\". [CHUNK_2] The letter symbols for funding sources are A for General funds, B for Special funds, C for General obligation bond funds, N for Federal funds, and W for Revolving funds. [CHUNK_3] General obligation bonds may be issued to yield the amount necessary to finance authorized projects, provided that the sum total of the bonds so issued shall not exceed $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_21]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "This Act appropriates funds for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_5] For JUD101 - Courts of Appeal, the operating appropriation from general funds is $9,592,659 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in FY 2025-2026 and $9,657,093 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_7] For JUD310 – First Circuit, the general fund operating appropriations are $98,130,866 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for FY 2025-2026 and $98,298,808 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_8] This circuit also has special fund appropriations of $4,261,273 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for each fiscal year. [CHUNK_8] For JUD320 – Second Circuit, the general fund operating appropriation is $20,150,130 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for each fiscal year. [CHUNK_8] The general fund operating appropriation for JUD330 – Third Circuit is $24,912,104 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in FY 2025-2026 and $24,903,209 (HB400_.HTM.txt) in FY 2026-2027. [CHUNK_9] Under JUD601 - Administration, the bill authorizes investment capital of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for FY 2025-2026 from general obligation bond funds. [CHUNK_11] The appropriations made for capital improvement projects shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [CHUNK_22] All appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [CHUNK_23]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The chief justice, or any agency or government unit, may secure federal funds or other property under any act of Congress, or any funds or other property from private organizations or individuals, to be expended in connection with any program or works authorized by this Act. [CHUNK_13] With the chief justice's approval, the agency or government unit may enter into the undertaking with the federal government, private organization, or individual. [CHUNK_14] The judiciary may also transfer savings from its general fund appropriation to the driver education and training fund to accommodate any temporary cash flow deficits. [CHUNK_15]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The sum of $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) is appropriated for capital improvement projects for FY 2025-2026. [CHUNK_15] The projects, with funding amounts listed in thousands of dollars in the Act, include $4,000,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for plans and design for a new South Kohala Judiciary Complex, $900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for A/C systems replacement at Pu‘uhonua Kaulike, and $5,000,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt) for lump sum CIP for judiciary facilities statewide. [CHUNK_17, CHUNK_18, CHUNK_19, CHUNK_20] General obligation bonds may be issued to finance these projects, provided that the sum total so issued shall not exceed $9,900,000 (HB400_.HTM.txt). [CHUNK_21]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The appropriations made for capital improvement projects authorized in this Act shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [CHUNK_22] All appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [CHUNK_23] All unrequired balances in the general obligation bond fund, after the objectives for capital improvements program purposes have been met, shall be transferred to the judiciary project adjustment fund. [CHUNK_25]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "No previous fiscal note was provided for comparison."
}

chunk_details.chunk_text: HB400 HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES H.B. NO. 400 THIRTY-THIRD LEGISLATURE, 2025 STATE OF HAWAII A BILL FOR AN ACT relating to the judiciary . BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII: PART I. GENERAL PROVISIONS SECTION 1. This Act shall be known and may be cited as

This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. SECTION 2. Unless otherwise clear from the context, as used in this Act: "Means of Financing," or "MOF," means the source from which funds are appropriated, or authorized, as the case may be, to

are appropriated, or authorized, as the case may be, to be expended for the programs and projects specified in this Act. All appropriations are followed by letter symbols. The letter symbols, where used, shall have the following meanings: A General funds B Special funds C General obligation bond funds N

funds B Special funds C General obligation bond funds N Federal funds W Revolving funds "Position ceiling" means the maximum number of permanent or temporary positions authorized for a particular program during a specified period or periods, as noted by an asterisk or pound sign, respectively. an asterisk or pound sign, respectively. "Program ID" means the unique identifier for the specific program, and consists of the abbreviation for the judiciary (JUD) followed by a designated number for the program. PART II. PROGRAM APPROPRIATIONS SECTION 3. The following sums, or so much thereof as may be sufficient

following sums, or so much thereof as may be sufficient to accomplish the purposes and programs designated herein, are appropriated or authorized from the sources of funding specified to the judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning July 1, 2025, and ending June 30, 2027. All unrequired balances in the general obligation bond fund, after the objectives of part II appropriations for capital improvements program purposes listed as projects in part IV of this Act have been met, shall be transferred to the judiciary project adjustment

been met, shall be transferred to the judiciary project adjustment fund. SECTION 12. If the amount allocated from the general obligation bond fund for a capital improvement project listed in part IV of this Act is insufficient, the chief justice may make supplemental allotments from the judiciary project adjustment fund;

may make supplemental allotments from the judiciary project adjustment fund; provided that supplemental allotments shall not be used to increase the scope of the project. SECTION 13. Where it has been determined that changed conditions, such as a reduction in the particular population being served, permit the reduction in the

the particular population being served, permit the reduction in the scope of a project listed in part IV of this Act, the chief justice may authorize such reduction of project scope. SECTION 14. The chief justice shall determine when and the manner in which the authorized capital improvement projects shall

the manner in which the authorized capital improvement projects shall be initiated. The chief justice shall notify the governor from time to time of the specific amounts required for the projects, and the governor shall provide for those amounts through the issuance of bonds authorized in part V of this

the issuance of bonds authorized in part V of this Act. SECTION 15. Any law or any provision of this Act to the contrary notwithstanding, the chief justice may supplement funds for any cost element for a capital improvement project authorized under this Act by transferring sums as may be

authorized under this Act by transferring sums as may be needed from the funds appropriated for other cost elements of the same project by this Act or by any other prior or future Act that has not lapsed; provided that the total expenditure of funds for all cost elements for

the total expenditure of funds for all cost elements for the project shall not exceed the total appropriation for that project. PART VII. MISCELLANEOUS PROVISIONS AND EFFECTIVE DATE SECTION 16. If any portion of this Act or its application to any person or circumstances is held to be invalid for

any person or circumstances is held to be invalid for any reason, the remainder of this Act and any provision thereof shall not be affected. If any portion of a specific appropriation is held to be invalid for any reason, the remaining portion shall be independent of the invalid portion

the remaining portion shall be independent of the invalid portion and shall be expended to fulfill the objective and intent of the appropriation to the extent possible. SECTION 17. If any manifest clerical, typographical, or other mechanical error is found in this Act, the chief justice may correct the error.

in this Act, the chief justice may correct the error. All changes made pursuant to this section shall be reported to the legislature at its next regular session. SECTION 18. This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025. INTRODUCED BY: _____________________________ By Request Report Title: Judiciary Package; Appropriations; Budget

BY: _____________________________ By Request Report Title: Judiciary Package; Appropriations; Budget Description: Appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. Effective 7/1/2025. The summary description of legislation appearing on this page is for informational purposes only and is not legislation or evidence of legislative intent.
